title: 2022 Toyota GR Supra 3.0
description: This 2022 Toyota GR Supra was delivered new to Servco Pacific Toyota in Honolulu, Hawaii, before being acquired by the selling dealer in 2024 and relocated to Washington State. Now with 950 miles, the car is finished in Nitro Yellow and powered by a turbocharged 3.0-liter inline-six linked with an eight-speed automatic transmission and an active rear differential. It was specified with the Safety and Technology Packages, and additional equipment include 19" 10-spoke forged aluminum wheels, an adaptive sport suspension, Brembo front brake calipers, heated sport seats trimmed in black leather and Alcantara, carbon-fiber interior trim, a JBL sound system, and touchscreen infotainment with navigation. This Supra is now offered by the selling dealer in Washington State with a window sticker, service records, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Hawaii title.
author: bringatrailer
excerpt: Bid for the chance to own a 2022 Toyota GR Supra 3.0 at auction with Bring a Trailer, the home of the best vintage and classic cars online. Lot #175,816.
text: This 2022 Toyota GR Supra was delivered new to Servco Pacific Toyota in Honolulu, Hawaii, before being acquired by the selling dealer in 2024 and relocated to Washington State. Now with 950 miles, the car is finished in Nitro Yellow and powered by a turbocharged 3.0-liter inline-six linked with an eight-speed automatic transmission and an active rear differential. It was specified with the Safety and Technology Packages, and additional equipment include 19″ 10-spoke forged aluminum wheels, an adaptive sport suspension, Brembo front brake calipers, heated sport seats trimmed in black leather and Alcantara, carbon-fiber interior trim, a JBL sound system, and touchscreen infotainment with navigation. This Supra is now offered by the selling dealer in Washington State with a window sticker, service records, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Hawaii title. The car is finished in Nitro Yellow and features matte black-finished front and rear splitters, rocker panels, and rear canards. Additional details include a double-bubble roof, an integrated rear spoiler, and six-lens auto-leveling LED headlamps with automatic high beams as well as LED taillights, front and rear parking sensors, and dual exhaust outlets. A scratch is noted on the right front splitter. The 19″ ten-spoke forged aluminum wheels are mounted with 255/35 front and 275/35 rear Michelin Pilot Super Sport tires. The car rides on an adaptive variable sport suspension, and stopping power is provided by four-wheel ventilated discs with Brembo four-piston front calipers. The heated power-adjustable sport seats are upholstered in black leather with Alcantara inserts and red and white contrasting stitching. Carbon fiber trim accents the cabin, and appointments include adaptive cruise control, a 12-speaker JBL audio system, dual-zone automatic climate control, and an 8.8″ touchscreen infotainment system with navigation and Apple CarPlay connectivity. Driver aids consist of launch control, blind spot monitoring, lane departure warning, rear cross-traffic alert, and Pre-Collision System with Pedestrian Detection. The leather-wrapped multifunction steering wheel frames a digital gauge cluster. The odometer indicates 950 miles. The turbocharged 3.0-liter inline-six was factory rated at 382 horsepower and 368 lb-ft of torque. An oil change was carried out in preparation for the sale. Power is sent to the rear wheels through a ZF eight-speed automatic transmission and an active rear differential. The window sticker shows initial delivery to Servco Pacific Toyota (SPI) in Honolulu, Hawaii, and lists factory colors, equipment, options, and a total price of $56,315. The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage. You are not connected to real-time updates. Attempting to connect. Your real-time updates could not be connected. html:
This 2022 Toyota GR Supra was delivered new to Servco Pacific Toyota in Honolulu, Hawaii, before being acquired by the selling dealer in 2024 and relocated to Washington State. Now with 950 miles, the car is finished in Nitro Yellow and powered by a turbocharged 3.0-liter inline-six linked with an eight-speed automatic transmission and an active rear differential. It was specified with the Safety and Technology Packages, and additional equipment include 19″ 10-spoke forged aluminum wheels, an adaptive sport suspension, Brembo front brake calipers, heated sport seats trimmed in black leather and Alcantara, carbon-fiber interior trim, a JBL sound system, and touchscreen infotainment with navigation. This Supra is now offered by the selling dealer in Washington State with a window sticker, service records, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Hawaii title.

The car is finished in Nitro Yellow and features matte black-finished front and rear splitters, rocker panels, and rear canards. Additional details include a double-bubble roof, an integrated rear spoiler, and six-lens auto-leveling LED headlamps with automatic high beams as well as LED taillights, front and rear parking sensors, and dual exhaust outlets. A scratch is noted on the right front splitter.

The 19″ ten-spoke forged aluminum wheels are mounted with 255/35 front and 275/35 rear Michelin Pilot Super Sport tires. The car rides on an adaptive variable sport suspension, and stopping power is provided by four-wheel ventilated discs with Brembo four-piston front calipers.

The heated power-adjustable sport seats are upholstered in black leather with Alcantara inserts and red and white contrasting stitching. Carbon fiber trim accents the cabin, and appointments include adaptive cruise control, a 12-speaker JBL audio system, dual-zone automatic climate control, and an 8.8″ touchscreen infotainment system with navigation and Apple CarPlay connectivity. Driver aids consist of launch control, blind spot monitoring, lane departure warning, rear cross-traffic alert, and Pre-Collision System with Pedestrian Detection.

The leather-wrapped multifunction steering wheel frames a digital gauge cluster. The odometer indicates 950 miles.

The turbocharged 3.0-liter inline-six was factory rated at 382 horsepower and 368 lb-ft of torque. An oil change was carried out in preparation for the sale.

Power is sent to the rear wheels through a ZF eight-speed automatic transmission and an active rear differential.

The window sticker shows initial delivery to Servco Pacific Toyota (SPI) in Honolulu, Hawaii, and lists factory colors, equipment, options, and a total price of $56,315.

The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage.
